lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/morpheus.morpheus.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run morpheus.morpheus.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
E | 0 | Go for Event | 24 Apr 2025, 1:00 PM | 24 Apr 2025, 3:00 PM

* Entry point for the Morpheus task manager application.
* Morpheus allows users to manage tasks of different types (ToDo, Deadline, Event)
* through a command-line interface. Users can add, list, mark, unmark, and delete tasks.
* This class initializes the core components:

*
  • {@link Storage} for saving and loading tasks

*
  • {@link List}<{@link Task}> for storing the current tasks
* The main program flow is handled by the {@link #run()} method, which continually
* reads user input, parses it into a {@link Command}, and executes it until the
* Constructs a new instance of Morpheus.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks are stored
* The main entry point of the application.
* Creates an instance of {@code Morpheus} with the default storage file
* The loop continues until an exit command is issued. On each iteration:

*
  • Prompts the user for input via {@link Ui}

*
  • Parses the input into a {@link Command} using {@link Parser}

*
  • Executes the command, modifying the task list and storage as needed

*
  • Exits the loop if the command signals termination
System.out.println("Looks like that line was empty. Try adding a task with 'todo', "
+ "'deadline', or 'event'. I'm ready when you are!");
System.out.println("Seems like you entered an invalid command. Please try again");
* Represents a command that adds a new task to the task list.
* This command is triggered when the user enters one of the following formats:
* Depending on the input, a {@link ToDoTask}, {@link DeadlineTask}, or {@link EventTask}
* is created and added to the provided task list. The {@link Ui} displays a confirmation
* message and the updated list is saved to {@link Storage}.
* Creates a new AddCommand based on the user's raw input.
* @param input the raw user input string that specifies the task type and details
* Determines the type of task based on the user's input.
* @param input the trimmed, lowercase user input
* Executes the add command by creating the appropriate task based on
* the parsed type and adding it to the provided task list.

*
  • Deadline: requires a description and a due time introduced with /by

*
  • Event: requires a description, a start time introduced with /from,
* and an end time introduced with /to

*
  • The {@link Storage} persists the updated task list

*
  • Other unexpected failures are caught and reported gracefully
* @param taskList the list of tasks to which the new task is added
* @param storage the storage handler used to save the updated task list
* @param ui the user interface handler responsible for displaying messages
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("your todo description looks a bit short. "
throw new IllegalArgumentException("I can only add a deadline once I have a due time. "
throw new IllegalArgumentException("I can only add an event once I have both start and "
throw new IllegalArgumentException("the end time can only happen after the event has "
+ "started. Please try again with a valid set of timings");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("I didn't recognise that task type. Please start "
+ "with 'todo', 'deadline', or 'event' and I'll take it from there.");
System.out.println("Sorry, something unexpected happened while adding that task. "
+ "Could I trouble you to add it in again?");
System.out.println("Looks like that line was empty. Whenever you're ready, type a task and "
* Represents a command that ends the program.
* This command is triggered when the user enters the keyword:
* Upon execution, a farewell message is displayed to the user and
* the current task list is saved to storage before termination.
* This terminates the program after saving tasks.
* Creates a new ByeCommand and sets the exit flag to {@code true}.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered this command
* Executes the bye command by displaying a farewell message
* and saving the current task list to storage.
* @param storage  the storage handler used to save tasks
* @param ui       the user interface handler responsible for displaying messages
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Represents an abstract user command in the Morpheus task manager.
* Each concrete subclass of {@code Command} corresponds to a specific user
* action, such as adding a task, listing tasks, or marking a task as done.

*
  • The raw user input string that triggered it

*
  • An {@code isExit} flag to indicate if the program should terminate after execution
* Subclasses must implement the {@link #execute(List, Storage, Ui)} method
* The raw input string entered by the user that created this command.
* A flag indicating whether this command causes the program to exit.
* @param input the raw user input that created this command
* Executes the command, performing its intended action.
* @param taskList the current list of tasks
* @param storage  the storage handler for saving tasks
* @param ui       the user interface handler for displaying output
public abstract void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui);
* Returns whether this command causes the program to terminate.
* @return {@code true} if this command should exit the program, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* This command is triggered when the user enters the keyword:
* Upon execution, the specified task is removed from the list,
* a confirmation message is displayed to the user, and the updated
* This removes the second task in the list.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered this command
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task
* The {@link Ui} is used to display a confirmation message with
* the deleted task and the updated task count.
* @param storage  the storage handler (unused here, but part of the interface)
* @param ui       the user interface handler responsible for displaying messages
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("I couldn't find that task number. "
+ "Try 'list' to see what's available, then pick a number from there.");
System.out.println("It seems I couldn't spot a task number after 'delete'. "
* Represents a command that searches for tasks containing a given keyword
* This command is triggered when the user enters the keyword:
* Upon execution, all tasks whose descriptions contain the search term
* (case-insensitive) are displayed to the user. A deep copy of the task list
* is used to ensure the original data remains unaffected.
* This will list all tasks with descriptions containing "book".
* @param input the raw user input that triggered this command
* Executes the find command by filtering tasks whose descriptions
* The {@link Ui} displays the filtered results to the user.
* @param storage  the storage handler (unused here, but part of the interface)
* @param ui       the user interface handler responsible for displaying results
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("It seems like you did not finish your find request. Could you please try again?");
* Represents a command that lists all tasks in the current task list.

* Represents a command that marks a task as completed.
* This command is triggered when the user enters the keyword:
* Upon execution, the specified task is updated to a completed state,
* the change is displayed to the user, and the task list is saved
* This marks the second task in the list as completed.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered this command

* the specified task in the task list to "done".
* The {@link Ui} is used to display a confirmation message, and
* the {@link Storage} is updated with the modified task list.
* @param storage the storage handler responsible for saving changes
* @param ui the user interface handler responsible for displaying messages
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("I couldn't find that task number. Try 'list' to see what's available, "
System.out.println("It seems I couldn't spot a task number after 'mark'. "
* Represents a command that marks a task as not completed.
* This command is triggered when the user enters the keyword:
* Upon execution, the specified task is updated to an incomplete state,
* the change is displayed to the user, and the task list is saved
* This marks the second task in the list as incomplete.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered this command
* Executes the unmark command by updating the completion status of
* the specified task in the task list to "not done".
* The {@link Ui} is used to display a confirmation message, and
* the {@link Storage} is updated with the modified task list.

* @param ui       the user interface handler responsible for displaying messages
public void execute(List<Task> taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
